Food labels provide important information that needs to be understood, not just read, particularly since two pressing health issues in our society are the overconsumption of fat and sugar. c.  The name 2% refers to the percent of the mass of milk that is composed of fat. The other components of milk are water (about 90%); carbohydrates, or sugars (about 4.8%), and protein (about 3.2%). It is important to discuss that each component of food has its own caloric density. For this reason, fat, which is 2% of the mass, can produce 37.5% of the calories, whereas water, which is 90% of the mass, produces 0% of the calories.
